means: 无产阶级的， （大工业的）工人阶级的

sentence.Network_en: We must now set about building a proletarian socialist state in Russia.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们必须现在就开始在俄国建立一个无产阶级社会主义国家.

sentence.Network_en: Dr. Norman Bethune impersonates the spirit of proletarian internationalism.
sentence.Network_cn: 白求恩医生体现了无产阶级国际主义精神.

sentence.Network_en: He is the father of proletarian literature.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是无产阶级文学的奠基人.

白求恩医生体现了无产阶级国际主义精神.  来自辞典例句  3. He is the father of proletarian literature.  他是无产阶级文学的奠基人.  来自辞典例句  4.
(Totally 9)proletarian adj. 无产者的；无产阶级的；工人阶级的By

list.abs: discussion on the religious works of the proletarian party under the new conditions ., 谈谈无产阶级政党在新形势下的宗教工作.
Suyu was a great proletarian revolutionist and an outstanding military scientist ., 粟裕是一位伟大的无产阶级革命家 , 杰出的军事家.
The Chinese revolution is part of the world's proletarian revolution.  中国革命是世界无产阶级革命的一部分。 a part of意为其中的“一小部分”,仅指整体.
...无产阶级国际主义（proletarian internationalism），也称国际共产主义运动（international socialism），是卡尔·马克思的一个社会阶级理论，其主张资本主义是一个全球体系，基于共同的阶级利益，因此工人阶级必须团结世界范围的其他工人阶级进行斗争。<.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin proletarius (from proles 'offspring'), denoting a person having no wealth in property, who only served the state by producing offspring, + -an

entry.def: Proletarian means relating to the proletariat.

entry.tran: 无产者；无产阶级的一员
entry.def: A proletarian is a member of the proletariat.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of the working class (not necessarily employed);
1. the lowest class of citizens of ancient Rome who had no property
2. belonging to or characteristic of the proletariat

auth_sentence.content: Drama clubs produced such plays as The Proletarian's Daughter.

means.word_mean: 无产阶级一员, 无产者, 产业工人, 劳工

sentences.en: His novels can be read as an account of the lives of the proletariat.
sentences.cn: 他的小说描写的是无产阶级的生活。
